title: Introducing The Official 2025 Haute 100 Miami List
body_text:
Introducing The Official 2025 Haute 100 Miami List
OUR ANNUAL HAUTE 100 LIST FOR 2025 IS OFFICIALLY HERE, CELEBRATING THE MOST INFLUENTIAL NAMES IN MIAMI, INCLUDING PHILANTHROPISTS, ENTREPRENEURS, POWER COUPLES, DEVELOPERS, CREATIVES, ATHLETES, HOSPITALITY POWER PLAYERS, AND MORE.
ATHLETES
DAVID BECKHAM
COMPANIES: DB VENTURES, AUTHENTIC BRANDS GROUP, STUDIO 99, INTER MIAMI CF
David Beckham OBE is a football phenomenon, with a career spanning over two decades. Since retirement, Beckham has established himself as a businessman, entrepreneur, and real Miami local. In 2019, Beckham founded Studio 99, a global production and content studio focusing on unscripted films, series, and format development across platforms like Netflix and Amazon Prime, among others. He fulfilled his lifelong ambition to become the owner of a football club when his group was awarded the MLS franchise for the City of Miami; thus, Inter Miami CF was born in 2020. Beckham has also been a Goodwill Ambassador with UNICEF since 2005, where he launched the groundbreaking David Beckham UNICEF Fund to protect millions of children worldwide from danger. Beckham also received a 2024 Emmy Award for his Netflix docuseries, BECKHAM.
UDONIS HASLEM
COMPANY: UDONIS HASLEM’S CHILDREN’S FOUNDATION
Born and raised in Miami, Udonis Haslem is a three-time NBA Champion and 20-year Miami HEAT veteran who has become a respected media personality, entrepreneur, and community leader. Since retiring as the franchise’s longest-tenured player, Haslem has expanded his impact across business, philanthropy, and broadcasting. He currently serves as vice president of basketball development for the Miami HEAT, along with being a studio analyst on Amazon Prime Video’s NBA coverage, and co-hosts the podcast “The Ogs” with former teammate Mike Miller. Beyond basketball, Haslem is a motivational speaker and philanthropist through the Udonis Haslem Foundation, advancing youth education, mental health, and economic empowerment in underserved communities. He also serves as an ambassador for Baptist Health’s Bounce Back from Cancer campaign, embodying his role as a cultural figure bridging sports, business, and social impact.
JAMAL MASHBURN
COMPANIES: HELEN HOLDINGS, MASHBURN FAMILY FOUNDATION
Most notably known for his success as a basketball player — with a career spanning over 12 years — NBA All-Star Jamal Mashburn has since evolved beyond the court. After retiring from the game, Mashburn has worked for ESPN as an analyst and launched several successful business ventures. Currently he is one of the TNT College Basketball sports analysts for the 2025/26 season. To date, he has ownership interest in numerous restaurant franchises, car dealerships, real estate ventures, hotels, and even the thoroughbred horse racing industry. Extremely civic-minded, Mashburn is committed to helping others and giving back to the community. He is a founding member, officer, and director of MAP, JAM Distribution and the Mashburn Family Foundation, which is a non-profit 501(c)(3) corporations.
BAM ADEBAYO
Edrice Femi “Bam” Adebayo, best known as “Bam,” is an American professional NBA basketball player for the Miami Heat as well as a former 2020 and 2025 Haute Living cover star. Known for his versatility and defensive prowess, Adebayo is also a two-time Olympic gold medalist and a three-time NBA All-Star. He was one of six South Florida Olympians to receive a key to Miami-Dade County for his display of athletic excellence during the 2024 Olympics. A Miami Heat team captain, Adebayo is celebrated for his strong rebounding, playmaking, and leadership on the court. Off the court, he is involved in philanthropic efforts through The BBB Foundation, which aims to change the lives of single mothers while developing future chances, choices, and challenges for children within the greater Miami and Florida areas.
TYLER HERRO
Tyler Herro is a dynamic guard for the Miami Heat, celebrated for his sharp shooting, clutch scoring, and relentless work ethic. Born in 2000 in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, Herro starred at Whitnall High School before excelling at the University of Kentucky, where his standout freshman season highlighted his offensive versatility. Drafted 13th overall by the Heat in 2019, he immediately became a key contributor, helping power Miami’s run to the NBA Finals as the youngest player ever to start a Finals game. In 2022, he earned NBA Sixth Man of the Year honors, underscoring his impact as a high-level scorer off the bench. Last season, Herro made his first NBA All-Star Game and was the sole Heat representative, further establishing himself as one of the league’s premier offensive threats and a cornerstone of Miami’s future.
ART AND DESIGN
ROMERO BRITTO
COMPANY: BRITTO GROUP
Romero Britto, the most collected and licensed artist in history, is the founder of the Happy Art Movement, creating a universal visual language of happiness and love through his art. His work has been exhibited in prestigious galleries and museums across more than 120 countries, and he has collaborated with some of the world’s biggest brands, including Absolut Vodka, Disney, Bentley, Hasbro, Mattel, LG, Samsung, and Hublot, among others. Britto led the opening for Super Bowl XLI with Cirque du Soleil and served as the official artist for the World Cup in both South Africa and Brazil, as well as for the 2016 Summer Olympics. His unique art is visible worldwide, appearing on consumer goods from his brand and on canvases as fine art. From a philanthropic perspective, Britto’s companies have donated to over 250 charitable organizations globally.
GARY NADER
COMPANY: GARY NADER ART CENTRE AND NADER MUSEUM
Considered one of the world’s most influential art dealers, Gary Nader has transformed Miami into a premiere destination for art and culture. Over the past four decades, he has built an extensive legacy, including the Gary Nader Art Centre, the Nader Museum, the acclaimed Botero Immersed Experience, and the Nader Sculpture Park, which houses over 50 monumental works in the Miami Design District. Nader is celebrated for his sophisticated curatorial vision, fostering dialogue between modern and contemporary masters, and leading Latin American artists, significantly elevating Miami’s global cultural profile.
RUBELL FAMILY
COMPANY: RUBELL MUSEUMS
The Rubell family, pioneers in contemporary art collecting, established the renowned Rubell Museums in Miami and Washington, D.C. Mera and Don began their art-collecting journey in 1964 and were joined by their son Jason in 1982. Today, their collection includes over 7,700 works by more than 1,000 artists. In 2024, the Rubell Museum D.C. presented a sweeping survey titled American Vignettes: Symbols, Society, and Satire. That winter, the Rubell Museum Miami premiered an artist-in-residence presentation by Vanessa Raw, a new acquisitions exhibition, and an expanded collection highlights exhibition.
ENTERTAINMENT
LUIS FONSI
Luis Fonsi is an award-winning global artist and one of the most influential figures in Latin music. With timeless hits such as “No Me Doy Por Vencido” and “Aquí Estoy Yo,” which won Song of the Year at the Latin Grammy Awards, Fonsi has become a defining voice in Latin pop. His biggest success, “Despacito,” made history as one of the most played songs of all time, with over eight billion video views, four Latin Grammy Awards, seven Billboard Latin Music Awards, five Billboard Music Awards, three Grammy nominations, and seven Guinness World Records. Fonsi has sold more than 11 million records worldwide and continues to thrive with number one hits including “Échame La Culpa,” “Imposible,” “Calypso,” and “Santa Marta.” He recently concluded his 25 Años World Tour, and his latest album, El Viaje, won the Latin Grammy for Best Latin Pop Album and earned a Grammy nomination.
KAROLINA KURKOVA AND ARCHIE DRURY
Internationally acclaimed supermodel Karolina Kurková has graced the covers of the world’s most prestigious fashion publications and fronted landmark campaigns for Chanel, Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Prada, and IWC Watches, among others. Beyond her celebrated career in fashion, Kurková is a board member of the esteemed Instituto Marangoni Miami, contributing her vision and experience to shaping the next generation of creative talent. She is also an active supporter of global philanthropic efforts, working with organizations such as amfAR and Feeding America. Kurková and her husband, Archie Drury — acclaimed producer of Sound of Freedom and Voices of Iraq — who is also a prominent real estate entrepreneur — share three children together. A former United States Marine, Drury joined forces with Kurková and the University of Miami to create the Fisher Island Medical Clinic. As a couple, they remain deeply committed to the Play for Play for Change Foundation.
PHARRELL WILLIAMS
COMPANIES: THE NEPTUNES, YELLOW, BLACK AMBITION, HUMANRACE™, LOUIS VUITTON
Pharrell Williams, the visionary recording artist, producer, songwriter, philanthropist, fashion designer, and entrepreneur, has thrived over the past few years in the LVMH family as the creative director of Louis Vuitton’s Menswear, succeeding the late Virgil Abloh. In addition to this role, Williams founded the apparel brands Billionaire Boys Club and Ice Cream, and partnered with David Grutman to open Swan, Bar Bevy, and The Goodtime Hotel in Miami Beach. Williams has earned prestigious awards, including Billboard’s Producer of the Decade as well as 13 Grammy Awards. His philanthropic ventures include YELLOW, a nonprofit supporting youth education, and Black Ambition, a nonprofit initiative providing a bridge to success for Black and Latinx entrepreneurs. He is also the founder of Humanrace, an awardwinning skincare line.
RICK ROSS
COMPANY: MAYBACH MUSIC GROUP
Rick Ross — born William Leonard Roberts II — is a Grammynominated rapper, mogul, and cultural icon who has redefined what it means to be a hip-hop entrepreneur. Since making his debut in 2006 with the platinum album Port of Miami, fueled by the legendary single “Hustlin’,” Ross has delivered chart-topping follow-ups including “Teflon Don” and “Richer Than I Ever Been,” and collaborated with legends like Jay-Z, Nas, and John Legend. As founder of Maybach Music Group, he launched the careers of stars such as Meek Mill and Wale, thus cementing his executive legacy. Beyond music, Ross is a prolific businessman with ventures spanning Wingstop, Checkers, Luc Belaire, Rap Snacks, Slippery Soap, and the Rick Ross Car & Bike Show at his famed Promise Land estate. A two-time New York Times bestselling author and Miami cultural ambassador, Ross embodies hustle, influence, and modern Black entrepreneurship.
MYLES SHEAR
COMPANY: PALM TREE CREW
Myles Shear is the CEO and co-founder of Palm Tree Crew, which encompasses Palm Tree Management, Palm Tree Records, Palm Tree Holdings, and the Palm Tree Music Festival. He guides a roster of award-winning, multiplatinum talent, including Gryffin, Sam Feldt, influential songwriter Petey Martin, and, most notably, international superstar Kygo. Under Shear’s management since 2012, Kygo has earned dozens of multiplatinum certifications, amassed 15 billion streams, sold out consecutive world tours, and broken records, becoming the first artist to reach one billion streams on Spotify. Shear and Kygo are now expanding into hospitality with the launch of Palm Tree Crew’s Palm Tree Club, a music-based experiential hotel and restaurant concept that opened in Miami in December 2024. In 2025, Shear and Kygo further expanded Palm Tree Club with the opening of three additional venues, establishing the brand as a global hospitality destination.
TIMBALAND
COMPANIES: MOSLEY MUSIC GROUP, VERZUZ, BEATCLUB, STAGE ZERO
Born Timothy Z. Mosley, Timbaland is a multi-platinum Grammy-winning super-producer recently named No. 3 on Billboard’s list of the 50 Greatest Producers of the 21st Century. He is the CEO of Mosley Music Group, a successful independent record label,selling over 25 million albums and 40 million singles. Timbaland is also the co-founder of the worldwide media phenomenon startup Verzuz with producer Swizz Beatz, where they have achieved multiple honors, including ASCAP’s Voice of the Culture Award. He is also the founder of the music creator platform Beatclub, the premiere global marketplace for connecting the music creator community with record labels, music publishers, and independent artists.
MARC ANTHONY
Marc Anthony, born Marco Antonio Muñíz in New York City to Puerto Rican parents, is the best-selling salsa artist of all time and a true ambassador of Latin music. Over four decades, he has earned dozens of RIAA gold and platinum certifications, 108 No. 1 Billboard hits, more than eight billion YouTube views, and over 15 billion global streams. Known for his soaring voice and electrifying live shows, he ranks among the top-grossing touring artists worldwide. Beyond music, Anthony has starred in films like El Cantante and Man on Fire, co-founded Magnus, and built a vast portfolio spanning sports, fashion, beverages, and hospitality, including stakes in the Miami Dolphins, Bulova, OCA, and sbe. Through his Maestro Cares Foundation and Somos Una Voz, he champions humanitarian causes. In 2023, he received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.
DEVELOPERS
GIL DEZER
COMPANY: DEZER DEVELOPMENT
An accomplished businessman and humanitarian, Gil Dezer is a real estate developer and one of the largest oceanfront property owners in Sunny Isles Beach. Dezer developed the Porsche Design Tower, a 60-story luxury tower that introduced the Dezervator, a revolutionary automobile elevator lift system. He has launched marquee lifestyle brands, including Residences by Armani/Casa and Hyde Midtown Suites and Residences in exclusive partnerships with the Related Group. In 2024, Dezer broke ground on Bentley Residences, the world’s first Bentley Motors-branded luxury tower. A proud supporter of local charities, he is one of the founders of the Mount Sinai Medical Center Foundation.
DON, KATRINA, AND DONAHUE III PEEBLES
COMPANY: THE PEEBLES CORPORATION
Don Peebles is the founder, chairman, and CEO of The Peebles Corporation, a national real estate investment and development company with an eight billion-dollar project portfolio and a pipeline spanning key markets nationwide. Katrina oversees the creative vision and direction of The Peebles Corporation’s design and marketing efforts. In addition to her corporate role, she serves on the board of directors for CARE Elementary School in Miami and as vice chair of the New York City Mission Society. Their son, Donahue Peebles III, serves as executive vice president of The Peebles Corporation, managing new acquisitions and business development while actively pursuing public and private real estate transactions for the company.
VLAD DORONIN
COMPANIES: AMAN GROUP, OKO GROUP
Vlad Doronin is an international investor and real estate developer specializing in luxury residential, commercial, and hospitality properties. As the founder and CEO of OKO Group, a leading real estate firm, and the owner, chairman, and CEO of Aman, the world’s preeminent resort brand, Doronin’s global portfolio continues to expand. OKO Group is developing several landmark projects in Miami, including an Aman hotel and branded residences on Miami Beach and 830 Brickell, Miami’s premiere office tower. Under his leadership, Aman has launched city destinations in Tokyo, New York, and Bangkok, with the first standalone Aman Residences opening in Tokyo in 2023. Doronin has also introduced strategic brand extensions, including Janu, Aman Club, Aman at Sea — set to launch Amangati in 2027 — and Aman Interiors, which showcases the brand’s design philosophy to private clients.
ART FALCONE
COMPANIES: ENCORE CAPITAL MANAGEMENT AND RESCORE PROPERTY CORP, FALCONE GROUP
Art Falcone is the co-founder managing principal of Encore Capital Management and Rescore Property Corp., which develops master-planned communities, apartment complexes, retail centers, condominiums, townhomes, and hotels. He is also the founder and managing principal of Miami Worldcenter, a mixeduse development spanning over 15 million square feet in downtown Miami. As CEO and chairman of Falcone Group, a vertically integrated real estate and land development organization, Falcone has established the company as an internationally recognized real estate corporation. He is a benefactor to various foundations and charities, including the Crohn’s and Colitis Foundation and SOS Children’s Villages, among others. Notably, in 2022, Falcone received the prestigious Horatio Alger Award.
RUSSELL GALBUT
COMPANIES: CRESCENT HEIGHTS, CRESCENT SEAS, GFO INVESTMENTS
Russell W. Galbut serves as Chairman of GFO Investments, a private wealth management firm specializing in real estate and hospitality-focused investments, and as co-founder of Crescent Heights, one of America’s largest developers of high-quality residential apartments and condominiums. For over five decades, he has been a leader in the urban mixed-use real estate sector, creating landmark properties in major gateway cities across the United States, including this year’s launches of Forma, 72 Park, and Five Park in Miami. Also this year, Galbut launched Crescent Seas, channeling his 50 years of building homes “in the sky” into creating luxury residences at sea. Drawing on his experience as former chairman of Norwegian Cruise Line, he blends high-end real estate design with the freedom of global travel, offering private residential ships that combine luxury living, community, and worldwide exploration.
KOBI KARP
COMPANY: KOBI KARP ARCHITECTURE AND INTERIOR DESIGN
Architect and global designer Kobi Karp has been shaping Miami’s skyline since founding Kobi Karp Architecture & Interior Design in 1995. A longtime Miami resident and award-winning AIA member, he has led the design of landmark residential and hospitality projects, including The Four Seasons Surf Club, The Shore Club, Fisher Island, and The Ritz-Carlton, South Beach. His recent work includes The Shell Bay Residences, Selene Oceanfront Residences, and Edge House Miami. Born in Israel and raised in Minneapolis, Karp studied architecture at the University of Minnesota and moved to Miami in the late 1980s. Influenced by Bauhaus and Miami’s Art Deco heritage, his work emphasizes contextual design and sustainability. Through innovation and collaboration, he continues to shape Miami’s evolving identity with thoughtful, forward-thinking, and timeless projects.
JOEY GOLDMAN, JESSICA GOLDMAN SREBNICK, AND SCOTT SREBNICK
COMPANY: GOLDMAN PROPERTIES
Power siblings Joey Goldman and Jessica Goldman Srebnick, alongside Jessica’s husband Scott Srebnick, lead the second generation of Goldman Properties, the visionary company founded by the late Tony Goldman, which transformed neighborhoods including SoHo (New York), Deep Ellum (Dallas), Miami Beach, Wynwood, and Doral. Joey, who knew early on he would follow in his father’s real estate footsteps, now oversees acquisitions and development for the firm. Jessica serves as co-chair and is also founder and CEO of Goldman Global Arts, lead curator of the internationally renowned Wynwood Walls, and cofounder of the Wynwood Walls Foundation. Scott, CEO of Goldman Properties, draws on three decades as a trial and appellate lawyer to guide the company’s diverse portfolio of office, retail, residential, and hospitality assets.
CHRISTY AND DAVID MARTIN
COMPANY: TERRA
Christy and David Martin are dedicated to making a difference in their native South Florida as active members and supporters of the region’s business and philanthropic communities. As CEO of Terra, one of South Florida’s leading real estate development companies, David has developed a portfolio spanning over eight million square feet of residential and commercial real estate, establishing Terra as a transformative force in shaping South Florida’s built environment. The Martins’ commitment to the community is evident through their significant involvement in various charitable, civic, environmental, arts, and cultural organizations, including the Nicklaus Children’s Hospital Foundation, the Freedom Tower, Overtown Youth Center, Vizcaya Museum and Gardens, The Bass Museum, and Teach for America.
JORGE PÉREZ, JON PAUL “JP” PÉREZ, AND NICHOLAS PÉREZ
COMPANY: RELATED GROUP
Jorge Pérez, founding executive chairman of Related Group, has been a pivotal figure in South Florida’s urban transformation for over 45 years. His commitment to innovation and excellence is carried forward by his two sons. Jon Paul “JP” Pérez, president and CEO of Related Group, is a visionary leader driving the company’s future, spearheading its expansion into Wynwood. Nicholas “Nick” Pérez, president of the Condominium Division, oversees the development of Related Group’s prestigious condominium portfolio, valued at over $17 billion Under their leadership, Related Group is experiencing unprecedented growth, with over 100 projects across various markets, including emerging areas. Recent achievements include launching residential ventures for renowned hospitality brands, most notably the two billion-dollar reimagining of the iconic Bahia Mar Marina with the St. Regis Resort and Residences, Fort Lauderdale, as well as the Waldorf Astoria Pompano Beach and W Pompano Beach Hotel & Residences. The team has also completed transformative mixed-use developments, such as Magnus Brickell and The Highley House.
ROBERT RIVANI
COMPANY: RIVANI INVESTMENT GROUP
Robert Rivani is an entrepreneur, retail entertainment innovator, and real estate visionary. As president of RIVANI, he has executed over $1 billion in real estate deals independently. Rivani’s leadership spans from Malibu to Miami, where he has transformed hospitality spaces by attracting top brands like Catch, Delilah, Gaia, Amara at Paraiso, and Rosa Negra. His dynamic and bold approach redefines excellence and creativity. Inspired by global travels and a taste for luxury, Rivani curates vibrant destinations with top-tier tenants. His latest project, Rivani, is a historic milestone, introducing the innovative ‘Class X’ office concept in Miami Beach, thus setting a new standard for luxury offices. His commitment to reimagining real estate drives RIVANI forward to set industry standards.
JEFFREY SOFFER
COMPANY: FONTAINEBLEAU DEVELOPMENT
Jeffrey Soffer is the chairman and CEO of Fontainebleau Development, one of the country’s premiere real estate development groups, specializing in large-scale lifestyle developments in the hospitality, retail, residential, and commercial sectors. He has been dedicated to Fontainebleau Development’s growth for over 25 years. Soffer led the one-billion-dollar expansion and renovation of the company’s landmark Fontainebleau Miami Beach, as well as the hotel’s new Coastal Convention Center and its upcoming pool deck enhancement. His company’s portfolio includes JW Marriott Miami Turnberry Resort & Spa, Hilton Nashville Downtown, and Fontainebleau Las Vegas. Soffer has also created numerous South Florida residential landmarks, including 1 Homes Jupiter Island, Turnberry Ocean Colony, Porto Vita, Fontainebleau II, Fontainebleau III, and Turnberry Village, among others.
BARRY STERNLICHT
COMPANY: STARWOOD CAPITAL GROUP
A pioneer of the real estate industry, Barry Sternlicht is a true trailblazer. He is the chairman and CEO of Starwood Capital Group, the private alternative investment firm focused on global real estate, hotel management, oil and gas, and energy infrastructure. Sternlicht is also the chairman of Starwood Property Trust, a leading diversified finance company. For the past three decades, Sternlicht has structured investments with an asset value of over $235 billion. In 2008,Sternlicht founded SH Group, a hotel management company that owns and manages the Baccarat Hotels & Resorts and 1 Hotel brands. Sternlicht also serves on the board of directors of The Estée Lauder Companies and the Real Estate Roundtable.
ALIRIO TORREALBA
COMPANY: MG DEVELOPER
Alirio Torrealba is the founder and CEO of MG Developer, redefining residential living across South Florida. After a career in the automotive industry, he launched MG Developer in 2015, becoming Coral Gables’ most active developer. In 2021, the company entered the multifamily sector with Metro Parc in Hialeah, which opened in 2025. Nearby, Metro Parc South and Metro Station 1 are now under construction, expanding the firm’s rental division. In 2022, MG unveiled The Village, a luxury 48-residence community in Coral Gables, set for completion in 2025. Looking ahead, Torrealba is planning a landmark mixed-use project in North Bay Village. With a $1.8 billion portfolio spanning 2,700 units across 4.3 million square feet, Torrealba also champions philanthropic efforts, donating two million dollars to Baptist Health, and advancing life-saving care through FundaHígado.
MANNY ANGELO VARAS
COMPANY: MV GROUP USA
Manny Angelo Varas is the visionary builder and CEO of MV Group USA, renowned for creating stunning homes for billionaires, entertainers, and business leaders worldwide. Highly sought after, the firm accepts only about 10 percent of project inquiries, with a waitlist of at least one year and a backlog exceeding $100 million. With over 15 years of experience and a focus on future value, MV Group enhances Miami’s profile with remarkable residences and multifamily projects, including Giorgio Armani’s Residences by Armani/ Casa, the Bezos family’s Journey’s End estate, a Star Island mansion for Rick Ross, and others.
MICHAEL STERN
COMPANY: JDS DEVELOPMENT GROUP
Michael Stern, JDS Development Group’s founder and CEO, pioneers innovative real estate development, construction, and acquisitions. Notable in New York City and Miami, JDS crafts award-winning residential, hospitality, and mixed-use landmarks. Stern’s philosophy drives design and construction boundaries for dynamic market projects. Expertise spans project management, sales, marketing, and real estate financing. Founded in 2002, JDS excels in complex endeavors, revitalizing architect Ralph Walker’s legacy with Walker Tower and Stella Tower conversions. The iconic 111 West 57th St skyscraper and Brooklyn Tower projects redefine pioneering design. Notable works include the Fitzroy and American Copper Buildings. In South Florida, Monad Terrace is now complete, and projects under construction include 888 Brickell Dolce & Gabbana Miami and Mercedes-Benz Places in Miami.
CAMILO MIGUEL JR.
COMPANY: MAST CAPITAL
Camilo Miguel Jr. is the founder and CEO of Mast Capital, a vertically integrated real estate investment and development firm he launched in 2006. Recognized for his visionary approach, Miguel enhances communities through high-end residential, commercial, and hospitality properties in regions with significant barriers to entry. With extensive experience, he excels in investment strategies, financial instruments, and project execution, positioning Mast Capital at the forefront of Miami’s transformation with landmark projects such as Cipriani Residences Miami and The Perigon Miami Beach, both under construction, along with a robust pipeline of developments. Miguel is also a dedicated philanthropist and community advocate, serving on the boards of the Perez Art Museum, Friends of The Underline, The Center for Arts and Innovation, and multiple Urban Land Institute councils.
ENTREPRENEURS
MICHAEL BAY
COMPANY: PLATINUM DUNES
Michael Bay is a trailblazing director and producer. Renowned for his exceptional commercial work, he won the Cannes Lions Grand Prix for Best Commercial with the “Got Milk?/Aaron Burr” spot, now considered a definitive classic. Transitioning to feature films, he launched Will Smith’s action-hero status with Bad Boys and Bad Boys II and delivered high-octane blockbusters such as The Rock, Armageddon, and the Transformers franchise, establishing him as one of the world’s highest-grossing directors. In 2019, Bay ventured into streaming with Netflix’s hit 6 Underground. His two production companies, Bay Films and Platinum Dunes, have achieved success across genres, earning him numerous accolades in the industry. In 2023, he ventured into true-crime docuseries with Born Evil, currently streaming on Investigation Discovery.
FAREED ADIB
Fareed Adib, a seasoned technology leader with over 25 years of experience, has a distinguished career managing billion-dollar businesses for global tech giants such as Google and SoftBank. Currently a managing director at Vista Equity Partners, a leading investment firm with over $100 billion in assets under management, Adib also serves on the boards of multiple technology companies. Actively engaged in Miami’s entrepreneurial community, he mentors aspiring business leaders and champions the local tech ecosystem. Additionally, Adib supports Code.org’s mission, serving on its board to expand computer science education in schools and promote participation from underrepresented groups.
WAYNE BOICH
COMPANIES: RESERVE PADEL, BOICH INVESTMENT GROUP
Wayne Boich is the founder and CEO of Reserve Padel, a leading luxury lifestyle padel brand. Since its launch in 2023, Reserve has developed premier clubs, hosted nationwide pop-ups and exhibitions, launched exclusive apparel and gear, and created its signature flagship tournament, the Reserve Cup Series, bringing world-class players to fans across the country. The brand currently operates five clubs in Miami and New York, with its first international Reserve Cup debuting in Marbella this year. Wayne also serves as chairman and CEO of Boich Investment Group, overseeing global investments and a robust U.S. real estate portfolio spanning hospitality, office, and residential assets. Alongside his wife, Wayne is deeply involved in philanthropic work, creating and supporting organizations such as Reserve Cares, among others.
WAYNE AND ARLENE CHAPLIN
COMPANIES: SOUTHERN GLAZER’S WINE & SPIRITS
Wayne Chaplin serves as president and CEO of Southern Glazer’s Wine & Spirits, the world’s pre-eminent distributor of beverage alcohol. Chaplin is involved in various philanthropic activities, including support of the Chaplin School of Hospitality and Tourism Management at Florida International University. Arlene is a passionate community leader known for her support of many organizations, including the American Cancer Society, Miami City Ballet, Mount Sinai Hospital, Pérez Art Museum Miami, and Women of Tomorrow Mentor and Scholarship Program. She is involved in developing communitybettering initiatives, including YogArt. Arlene established the Arlene J. Chaplin Endowed Marketing Chair in the Patti and Allan Herbert Business School at University of Miami. The Chaplins were inducted into Miami-Dade County Public Schools’ Alumni Hall of Fame and are also long-time supporters of Miami Country Day School and Lehrman Community Day School.
WILLIAM DEAN
COMPANY: M.C. DEAN, INC.
William Dean serves as the CEO of M.C. Dean, Inc., a global engineering and systems integration firm specializing in cyber-physical solutions for mission-critical facilities, secure environments, complex infrastructure, and global enterprises. Deeply engaged in the South Florida community, he has led signature projects such as the Miami Convention Center and the Port Miami Tunnel, among others. He also spearheaded the renovation of the S.S. Kresge estate, Terra Veritatis, on the Indian Creek waterfront, which has hosted some of Miami’s most high-profile events. His philanthropic endeavors include supporting the Global Empowerment Mission, Wreaths Across America, and endowments at major engineering universities and the Girls Institute for Technology, among other initiatives.
TOM GARFINKEL
COMPANIES: MIAMI DOLPHINS, HARD ROCK STADIUM, FORMULA 1 CRYPTO.COM MIAMI GRAND PRIX
Tom Garfinkel is the vice chairman, president, and CEO of the Miami Dolphins and Hard Rock Stadium, as well as the managing partner of the Formula 1 Crypto.com Miami Grand Prix. Over the past 15 years, Garfinkel has driven the business success of the Dolphins and spearheaded the transformation of Hard Rock Stadium into a global entertainment destination. The venue is also home to the Miami Open, the Formula 1 Crypto.com Miami Grand Prix, the Precision Drive Club, the Orange Bowl, international concerts, the 2026 FIFA World Cup, and the 2026 CFP National Championship Game. Under Garfinkel’s leadership, the organization has led the NFL in community impact, raising nearly $100 million for cancer research, which benefits the Sylvester Comprehensive Cancer Center.
KEN GRIFFIN
COMPANY: CITADEL
Kenneth C. Griffin is the founder and CEO of Citadel, a leading global alternative investment firm, and the founder and non-executive chairman of Citadel Securities, a pre-eminent market maker. A dedicated philanthropist, Griffin has donated over two billion dollars throughout his decades of philanthropy. Through Griffin Catalyst, his contributions continue to expand access to education for millions of Americans, transform research and medical institutions with historic gifts, and strengthen cultural institutions. Griffin’s insights were instrumental in the launch of Operation Warp Speed, accelerating COVID-19 vaccine development and deployment strategies.
THOMAS KATO
COMPANIES: MERCHANT HUB, ROCK 13 TEQUILA
Thomas Kato’s entrepreneurial skills have paved the way for a remarkable career. With a portfolio encompassing commercial development properties, and a worldwide trading company called Rock 13 Trading, Kato is at the forefront of fintech innovation. Rock 13 Trading specializes in optimizing power plant efficiency, saving dissipated electricity, and supplying raw materials. Additionally, Kato has made strides in the financial sector with Merchant Hub, a cutting-edge payment processing business. The Harvard Business School alum believes the transformative role of blockchain in our financial landscape has shifted his focus to the launch of Comet Cash, a multinational protocol dedicated to global remittances and payments. This innovative platform facilitates the seamless conversion of fiat to crypto and vice versa, with minimal costs for consumers and merchants alike utilizing his new payment rails.
KEVIN O’LEARY

He is also the co-founder of Terran Orbital, a pioneering aerospace and defense satellite manufacturer acquired by Lockheed Martin, and co-founded Armour Residential REIT, a leading mortgage real estate investment trust. Recently, the couple has begun acquiring commercial real estate for development in Miami and Miami Beach. Together, Marc and Jennifer are committed to numerous philanthropic initiatives. Marc serves on several nonprofit boards, including those of New York University and SOS Children’s Villages Florida.
LOUIS AND ANGELA BIRDMAN
COMPANIES: BIRDMAN REAL ESTATE DEVELOPMENT, ONE THOUSAND GROUP
Louis and Angela Birdman are dedicated to making a positive impact on their community while transforming Miami’s skyline. His recent developments, currently under construction, include Villa Miami, a Major Food Groupbranded residential tower. EDGARDO AND ANA CRISTINA DEFORTUNA

Its portfolio includes notable developments such as Jade Residences at Brickell Bay, Jade Beach, Jade Ocean, Auberge Beach Residences and Spa Fort Lauderdale, The Ritz-Carlton Residences, Sunny Isles Beach, Jade Signature, The RitzCarlton Residences Pompano Beach, The St. Regis Residences, Sunny Isles Beach, Faena Residences, Nexo Residences, and Ora by Casa Tua in the heart of Brickell.

Gloria and Emilio Estefan are the ultimate entertainment power couple. Emilio is a musician and producer behind the success of many famous music artists, as well as an entrepreneur, owning and operating three restaurants, two hotels, and an internationally recognized publishing company. They’ve been inducted into the Latin Songwriters Hall of Fame and honored with the Presidential Medal of Freedom — the first time in history the honor was bestowed upon a couple. BRENT SAUNDERS AND DANIELA BOTERO
COMPANIES: BAUSCH + LOMB AND XIRÜ
Brent Saunders and Daniela Botero Saunders are prominent figures in the health, beauty, and wellness industries. He previously held the roles of chairman and CEO of Allergan plc, the maker of Botox, leading the company until its acquisition by AbbVie in 2020. He also serves as chairman of Beauty Health Company and Roam, sits on the board of directors of Mount Sinai Medical Center in Miami Beach, and is an active investor and philanthropist. Daniela, a model and actress, is launching XIRÜ, a natural skincare line blending ancestral wisdom with modern science. Built around its hero ingredient, Cacay oil, XIRÜ products are clean, crueltyfree, dermatologically tested, while also supporting reforestation and indigenous communities through its XIRÜstainability program. Together, they recently welcomed their first daughter.
DR. PHILLIP AND PATRICIA FROST
COMPANY: OPKO HEALTH, INC., FROST MUSEUM OF SCIENCE
Dr. Phillip and Patricia Frost are generous supporters of education, science, and the arts and are renowned collectors. They endowed the Frost School of Music at the University of Miami and were the lead donors for the Frost Art Museum at Florida International University. They also serve as the lead donors of the Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science in Downtown Miami’s Museum Park. As a result of a transformative $100 million gift, the Frost Institute of Chemistry and Molecular Science (FICMS) is the first one within a group of synergistic research institutes to be coordinated under the umbrella of the Frost Institutes for Science and Engineering at the University of Miami.
MICHAEL AND NIKKI SIMKINS

Michael and Nikki Simkins are visionary leaders redefining luxury hospitality and lifestyle branding from the heart of Miami. Together, the Simkins are shaping Miami’s cultural and commercial landscape while contributing to the community through philanthropic initiatives.

John O. Utendahl and Radmila Lolly are pivotal figures in shaping Miami’s vibrant cultural and philanthropic scene. HEATHER AND DAYMOND JOHN

Their partnership extends from their home life to the boardroom, where together they craft ideas, strategies, and opportunities for a diverse range of business deals. Heather’s insight and expertise empower them to expand their range of services and enhance.
IVANKA TRUMP AND JARED KUSHNER
COMPANY: AFFINITY PARTNERS
Ivanka Trump is an American businesswoman and served as advisor to the President (2017– 2021) under her father, Donald Trump, working on economic empowerment, entrepreneurship, and women’s initiatives. She held executive roles at the Trump Organization, oversaw major realestate projects, and launched the Ivanka Trump brand (now shuttered). Since leaving government, she has remained active in private ventures and philanthropy. Her husband, Jared Kushner, is the founder of Affinity Partners and served as a senior advisor in the Trump administration. He played central roles in negotiating the Abraham Accords, U.S.– Mexico–Canada (USMCA) trade framework, and co-authored Breaking History: A White House Memoir. Ivanka and Jared, both Ivy League–educated, live in South Florida with their three children.
LEO MESSI AND ANTONELA ROCCUZZO
Antonela Roccuzzo is an entrepreneur, philanthropist, and global style icon whose influence extends from fashion to social impact. Featured in Vogue México and Harper’s Bazaar Brazil as well as Haute Living, she represents brands such as Adidas and Tiffany & Co.., embodying wellness and elegance. Committed to empowering youth, she champions initiatives like Estudiar es Mejor in Argentina, promoting access to education. A devoted mother of three, she inspires millions with her authentic approach to fitness, family, and balance. Meanwhile, Lionel Andrés “Leo” Messi really needs no introduction given that he’s one of football’s greatest legends. A La Masia prodigy, Messi became FC Barcelona’s all-time top scorer, winning 10 La Liga and four UEFA Champions League titles. He later starred for PSG and now leads Inter Miami. Internationally, Messi crowned his career by guiding Argentina to triumphs at the 2021 and 2024 Copa América and the 2022 FIFA World Cup.
NAEEM KHAN AND MADLENA KALINOVA

Designer Naeem Khan and model Madlena Kalinova are a power couple shaping Miami’s cultural glamour. The city’s vibrant, sun-drenched energy infuses Khan’s collections with chic, worldly elegance that reflects their lifestyle. Valeria Lipovetsky, a purpose-driven entrepreneur and creative director, inspires over 6.8 million followers across YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, and Facebook with her focus on selfdiscovery, fashion, and wellness. JEFF BEZOS AND LAUREN SANCHEZ
Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sánchez are one of the world’s most dynamic power couples, blending innovation, influence, and philanthropy. As partners in life and purpose, Bezos and Sánchez embody a shared legacy of leadership, innovation, and commitment to shaping a better future for generations to come.

SAM AND EMINA NAZARIAN

Sam and Emina Nazarian are a powerhouse couple who continue to shape global hospitality, philanthropy, and culture. MARIO AND JESSICA CRISTOBAL
Mario and Jessica Cristobal, married since 2006, are a powerhouse couple defined by leadership, service, and impact. Jessica is Mrs. Florida International 2025, founder of the Leading Ladies League, publisher of Leading Ladies Magazine, and author of The Leading Ladies Guidebook. With their two sons, the Cristobals embody legacy and a shared commitment to excellence, empowering those around them and making a lasting difference.

MAYOR FRANCIS SUAREZ
Francis X. Suarez, the 43rd mayor of Miami, was first elected with 86 percent of the vote and reelected with nearly 79 percent. He has focused on reducing crime and taxes, expanding economic opportunity, and advancing the Miami Forever Agenda, a vision rooted in innovation and resilience. Suarez has championed tech growth through Venture Miami, expanded affordable housing through the Miami For-Everyone plan, and led efforts to connect education and job training with emerging sectors such as fintech, medtech, and greentech. A graduate of Florida International University (finance, top 10 percent) and the University of Florida Levin College of Law (cum laude), he previously served as president of the U.S. Conference of Mayors. Suarez is of counsel at Quinn Emanuel LLP and lives in Miami with his wife, Gloria, and their two children.
HOWARD LERMAN
COMPANIES: ROAM, YEXT
Howard Lerman, a trailblazing entrepreneur and tech visionary, is the former CEO and co-founder of Yext, a pioneering technology company specializing in digital knowledge management. Under his leadership, Yext became an industry leader, providing innovative solutions for companies to manage their online presence. Lerman’s dedication to technological advancement and commitment to helping businesses thrive in the digital age have solidified his reputation as a leading figure in tech entrepreneurship. His latest venture, Roam, a groundbreaking virtual office platform headquartered in Miami, powers over 10 million.

As the leader of Ripple, Garlinghouse champions blockchain technology to revolutionize crossborder payments. His vision and commitment to innovation have propelled Ripple to the forefront of the fintech industry, making him a prominent figure in the world of cryptocurrency and blockchain.
